c74object.name: j.message_array
c74object.digest: Declare an array of input nodes in a Jamoma model
c74object.description: j.message_array declares an array of input nodes in a Jamoma model. It wraps j.message features used to receive within a Jamoma model messages sent remotely from other Jamoma externals (ie. j.send, j.map) or sent at the model inlet. Nodes' name are automatically given an instance number starting from 1.
c74object.discussion:
j.message is an access point to receive messages within a model. The message value can be updated immediately from parent patcher, or by easing over time. Common types of messages, such as frequency, can be controlled using several different units (e.g. Hz, midinote or midicent) interchangeably.
User interfaces can control messages remotely. Mappings enable one message to dynamically control the value of another message. Cues can send messages to models as well.
Additionally the message enables inter-application communication. The message is provided with a unique global OSC address, and messages can be declared on the network in order for other applications, such as i-score, to inspect and control models.

inlet.description: Index of the instance to send value to. (1 to max number of instance. * will send value to all instances)

outlet.description: Message's value. When format attribute is set to single (default) output will be the selected instance message's value. When format is set to array, output will be a list of all message's value.

objarg.name: name
objarg.description: Message nodes array name defined using a bracket-based syntaxe: my/message.[2]

method.name: array
method.digest: Dispatch a list of values to instances of the messages
method.description: Dispatch a list of values to instances of the messages

method.name: array/select
method.digest: This message select which instance to address
method.description: This message select which j.message_array's instance to address

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang at leftmost inlet outputs its current value

method.name: int
method.description: An int at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the @type attribute, the value might get converted into a float value if the @type attribute is decimal or array or into a string if the @type attribute is string

method.name: float
method.description: A float at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the @type attribute, the value might get converted into a int value if the @type attribute is integer or into a string if the @type attribute is string

method.name: list
method.description:
A list at the leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. If the @type is decimal, integer or string, only the first list member will be used to set the value, and the type of this list member might be converted to fit the specified @type of the parameter
If the @type attribute is decimal, integer or array and ramping is enabled (as specified by @ramp/funcion and @ramp/drive), the two last list members can be used to request a ramp over time to the new value. If so, the second last list member should be the symbol ramp and the last list member specifies the desired ramp time in milliseconds
If the @type is decimal, integer or array and a dataspace is used (as specified by @dataspace and @unit), the new value can be set using alternative units. In this case the unit of new value is provided immediately following the numerical value, as either the last list member or as thre third last list member if a ramp is also being requested. If an alternative unit is requested as well as a ramp, the ramping will happen according to the dataspace unit being used temporarily

method.name: address
method.digest: Set an array of node names
method.description: The message address followed by a symbol containing a number of instances placed in bracket (ie. buffer.[5]/clear) sets the name of the nodes. This replaces the names provided initially as an argument to the object and allows to create nodes dynamically

The + message increments the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to increase the value by (default 1)

The - message decrements the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to decrease the value by (default 1)

method.name: dec
method.description: The dec message decrements the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to decrease the value by (default 1)

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump all attribute settings to rightmost outlet
method.description: The message dump outputs all attribute settings to rightmost outlet

method.name: inc
method.description: The inc message increments the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to increase the value by (default 1)

method.name: init
method.description: The message init sent to the leftmost inlet reset the current value to the value defined by the @default attribute

method.name: anything
method.digest: If the symbol equals the name of a setable parameters for the current ramp function, the value for that parameter can be updated. Else the message is interpreted as a new value for j.parameter. Depending on the @type it might be converted to one or more decimals (@type decimal or array) or an integer (@type integer).

attribute.name: format
attribute.digest: Format of the values output: single or array
attribute.description: Format of the output values. When set to single (default), output will be the selected instance received value. When set to array, output will be a list of all instances received value.

enum.name: single
enum.digest: Output the selected instance messages value
enum.description: Output the selected instance messages value

enum.name: array
enum.digest: Output the all instances messages value as a list
enum.description: Output the all instances messages value as a list

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: The @active attribute allows to enable (default: 1) or disable a node

attribute.name: clipmode
attribute.digest: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description:
The @clipmode attribute defines how values exceeding range will be clipped. Available clipmodes are:
none: when set tot none (default), exceeding values will be left untouched
low: when set to low, values exceeding the lower bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the upper bound will be left untouched
high: when set to high, values exceeding the upper bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the lower bound will be left untouched
both: when set to both, values exceeding lower or upper bounds will be clipped
wrap: when set to wrap, values exceeding lower or upper bound will wrap around the opposite bound
fold: when set to fold, values exceeding lower or upper bound will fold back within the defined range

attribute.name: dataspace
attribute.description:
The @dataspace attribute defines a dataspace used by this node. This enables values to be updated using several alternative units interchangeably, such as degree and radian for the angle dataspace. Available dataspaces are:
none (default)
angle
color
distance
gain
orientation
position
speed
temperature
time
Note that dataspace and units conversion features are enable when type attribute is set to interger, decimal or array

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The @default attribute sets the value to output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The @description attribute allows to associate a comment describing what this node controls. The description is used when auto-documenting models.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The @priority attribute controls in what order several values of a state of a Jamoma model will get sent on model initialization or when recalling a preset or cue

attribute.name: ramp/drive
attribute.description:
The @ramp/drive attribute defines the scheduler driving the ramp. Available options are:
none (default): no ramping permitted
max: using the Max scheduler
system: using the system clock
external: value is output with ramp time appended so it can be processed out of j.parameter (ie. using Max's line~)Note that in Max, it is recommended to use max rather than system.

attribute.name: ramp/function
attribute.description: The @ramp/function defines an easing function used for ramping. A wide range of easing functions as well as windowing functions are available. Please refer to the help file for further details

attribute.name: ramp/function/parameters
attribute.digest: Configurable parameters for the current ramp function
attribute.description: The @ramp/function/parameters is a read-only attribute listing all configurable parameters for the current ramp function. Certain ramp functions as specified by the @ramp/function attribute have additional configurable parameters that can be changed dynamically to modify the shape of the ramping curve. The message ramp/function/parameters cause j.parameter, j.message and j.return to output a list of all such parameters from the rightmost outlet, prepended by the symbol ramp/function/parameters. Refer to the help file for j.ramp for an overview of what functions have additional configurable parameters

attribute.name: ramp/status
attribute.description: The @ramp/status attribute is a read-only attribute that will be set to 1 when value is currently performing a ramp, and changed to 0 when done

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The @range attribute defines the expected range of possible values. Depending on the @clipmode attribute, this might be a recommended or definitive range.

attribute.name: repetitions/filter
attribute.description: The @repetitions/filter attribute defines whether repetited values will be filtered out or not (default)

attribute.name: stepsize
attribute.digest: Step size when incrementing or decrementing value
attribute.description: The @stepsize attribute defines a step value used when incrementing or decrementing the value using one of the messages +, -, inc or dec

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The @tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter, and is also useful when restricting namespace searches using j.namespace.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description:
The type attribute define the type of the value. Possible types are:
none (j.message and j.return only)
generic
boolean
decimal
integer
array
string
Note that value of type integer, decimal and array enable to use a dataspace and unit as well as ramp features.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The @unit attribute defines the dataspace unit used by this node. Values will get output according to this unit
